jobs.title: Executive Assistant (EA)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Executive Assistant (EA) with Sales Support Responsibilities

📍 Remote, India | Full-Time

About Us

Playpower Labs is a leading EdTech Services company on a mission to revolutionize learning at scale using cutting-edge technology. Founded as a non-profit in 2009, we now collaborate with some of the world’s largest education organizations, including India's Ministry of Education, to deliver impactful education technology solutions.

Role Overview

We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Executive Assistant (EA) who can take ownership of tasks and drive them to completion. This role also includes light sales support, such as outreach on LinkedIn and email follow-ups from conference lists. The ideal candidate is highly organized, resourceful, and relentless in ensuring tasks are executed efficiently.

Key Responsibilities

  • Provide high-level administrative support, including scheduling, filing insurance claims, and handling registrations.

  • Assist with sales outreach, including messaging prospects on LinkedIn and sending emails from conference lists.

  • Register for conferences, coordinate follow-ups, and liaise with key contacts.

  • Take full ownership of assigned tasks and ensure they are completed successfully.

  • Communicate effectively with internal teams and external stakeholders.

What We’re Looking For

  • Strong organizational and multitasking skills with an ability to prioritize tasks.

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

  • Proactive and persistent approach to completing tasks.

  • Experience with LinkedIn outreach, email correspondence, and basic administrative functions.

  • Self-motivated, detail-oriented, and capable of working independently in a remote environment.

What We Offer

✅ Competitive salary and benefits package
✅ Flexible working hours in a fully remote work environment
✅ Opportunities for professional growth and development
✅ A supportive and innovative team culture

If you’re someone who takes initiative, thrives in a fast-paced environment, and enjoys both administrative and sales-related tasks, we’d love to hear from you!

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Developer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Senior Full Stack Developer, Software Development
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with product management team to ensure we're building the best products.

  • Ability to lead a small team (globally distributed) of 6-8 individuals and help drive sound engineering design, process and quality practices, and perform acceptance engineering.

  • Ability to comprehend business requirements and be able to map them to technical data requirements.

  • Strong emphasis on code automation so it is maintainable and extensible.

  • Perform research, analysis, design and implementation and provide effective solutions for short term and long term needs.

  • Support and migrate existing systems to new platforms.

  • Mentor other team members and developers, leading by example and insisting on high standards.

  • Work in a team environment and share knowledge.

  • Evaluate new technologies and software products to determine feasibility and desirability of incorporating their capabilities into the platform.

  • Contributes as a hands-on software developer.

Qualifications

  • Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, with strong fundamentals and problem solving skills.

  • 6+ years experience in software development roles.

  • 4+ years minimum experience working in an agile environment is required.

  • At least 2-3 years of experience as Technical Lead or Architect.

  • We use Angular for our micro-front end architecture, backed by GraphQL BFF services. Experience with this or similar frameworks is desired.

  • We build microservices on AWS (including a variety of managed services) and GCP using a mix of technologies including Node.js, Java/Spring, Python, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, DynamoDB, Docker and Kubernetes (EKS).  Experience in some of these technologies and an eagerness to learn others is required.

  • Experience in design and development of web services.

  • Experience with Cloud Deployments, AWS plus.

  • Expert knowledge and capabilities in Object Oriented Analysis & Design.

  • Proficient in NoSQL and document-based database design and function, preferably MongoDB and Dynamo. Experience with SQL and relational database design considered a plus.

  • Expert knowledge of UML and design patterns.

  • Working knowledge of unit testing frameworks such as JUnit, Mockito, TestNG.

Skills

  • Software Design, Implementation (i.e. coding), and Testing

  • Web development.

  • Ability to work with onsite and remote teams.

  • Communication – be able to communicate information to persons with varying degrees of computer knowledge.

  • Problem solving and troubleshooting skills.

  • Desire to expand knowledge in many development languages, applications, and tools.

  • Proven ability to quickly learn new processes and tools, business domains and technical applications.

  • Ability to think technically and analytically.

  • Ability to understand philosophy of architecture.

  • Must assimilate information, distill knowledge, apply experience and provide solution alternatives and recommendations.

  • Must have strong time management skills - including ability to work well under pressure, plan, set priorities, adapt to change, and meet established timelines.

  • Must develop effective relationships with internal and external contacts and work well within a team.

  • Must be a self-starter and detail-oriented.

  • Must have a “positive” and energetic demeanor.

  • Effective written and verbal communication skills.

  • Creative problem-solving skills.What We Offer:

  • Competitive salary/benefits, fully remote work, professional development, and a supportive, innovative team culture.

jobs.title: Frontend Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Front-End Developer PlayPower Labs | Remote | Full-Time

Role Overview:

Join our front-end development team, contributing to user-centric applications using Angular and React. You'll work alongside skilled developers, growing your skills and ensuring high-quality code and user experiences. You will be encouraged to utilize and learn about AI tools to enhance your development workflows.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Work within a team of front-end developers, contributing to collaborative projects.

  • Develop and implement scalable web application features using Angular and React.

  • Collaborate with UX/UI designers to build intuitive user interfaces.

  • Adhere to coding standards and participate in quality assurance processes.

  • Learn from senior team members and contribute to continuous improvement.

  • Explore and integrate industry trends and emerging technologies, including AI tools.

  • Utilize AI tools to improve development efficiency and workflow.

  • Participate in code reviews.

  • Collaborate with back-end developers for seamless integration.

Qualifications:

  • 2+ years front-end experience with strong Angular and/or React skills.

  • Solid understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

  • Experience with state management (e.g., Redux, NgRx) and responsive design.

  • Familiarity with Git and Agile.

  • Good problem-solving and communication skills.

  • Interest or experience in using AI tools to improve development efficiency.

  • Basic understanding of Large Language Models (LLMs) and prompting (a plus).

  • Basic backend coding experience with Node.js or Python (a plus).

What We Offer:

Competitive salary/benefits, fully remote work, professional development, and a supportive, innovative team culture.

jobs.title: Teacher Co-Designer (Literacy Assessment — Fluency & Comprehension)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Summary

We’re building a digital literacy product that measures oral reading fluency and reading comprehension, helping teachers track growth and intervene earlier. We’re looking for a current or former classroom teacher to co-design the next iteration with us - shaping tasks, rubrics, and teacher workflows so the tool fits real classrooms.

What you’ll do
- Co-design assessment tasks and teacher/student flows for fluency (ORF) and comprehension.
- Define fluency protocols and create scoring guides/rubrics.
- Pilot quickly with teachers/students; synthesize feedback; iterate in tight cycles.
- Align items to standards (e.g., CCSS/State) and Science of Reading principles; ensure cultural relevance and accessibility.
- Contribute to data quality: inter-rater reliability checks, item review logs, and annotation guidelines.

You’re a great fit if you…
- Have 10+ years teaching ELA/literacy (Middle school or higher) and have administered fluency/comprehension assessments in US.
- Are comfortable co-designing with a product team and doing light usability testing.
- Write crisp, teacher-friendly copy and can calibrate rubrics with examples.

Scope & time
- Part-time contract: ~10 hours/week for 8-12 weeks (extendable).
- Remote, async-friendly with 1-2 short syncs/week.

Deliverables

- Pilot plan, teacher feedback synthesis, and iteration notes.

- Draft teacher instructions and quick-start materials.
